q: the incident reflects a new, more reactive attitude toward slights emanating from Larry Page, the Google co-founder who will become CEO in April and is considered more volatile and less diplomatic than outgoing CEO Eric Schmidt . Google's complaint is the height of hypocrisy. The company's entire business model is built on the use of other people's content usually without bothering to seek permission, said John Simpson, from Consumer Watchdog's Inside Google research team. Google's allegations are an attempt to make Microsoft look bad for doing what every search provider does constantly: analyse competitors' search engines

recommendation to President Bush at a National Security Council meeting Feb. 3, 2003, in which Colin Powell sketched out the presentation he was to make at the U.N. two days later. Rumsfeld quotes himself as telling the meeting, We should hit Khurmal during the speech, given that Colin Powell will talk about it. Khurmal is the name of a village near the site. Colin Powell objected. In his U.N. presentation, Colin Powell described it as "Terrorist Poison and Explosive Factory, Khurmal." Rumsfeld said Khurmal was operated by Ansar
